author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Live: Amtrak train derails in Washington state; at least 6 dead
summary: An Amtrak train traveling from Seattle to Portland, Ore., derailed near a highway overpass in Pierce County, Washington, on Monday morning, leaving at least 6 people dead and dozens of others injured, officials there say. Yahoo News is collecting live updates from police, first responders and local media. For the latest, see the live blog below.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Power of kneeling Kennesaw State cheerleaders revealed in president's resignation
summary: There is debate over whether protests during the anthem have had much of an effect at the NFL level. But the protests among the “Kennesaw Five” led to a change at the highest level of their university.

author: third_watch
title: Navy pilot recalls encounter with UFO: 'I think it was not from this world'
summary: Retired Cmdr. David Fravor spent 18 years as a Navy pilot, but nothing prepared him for what he witnessed during a routine training mission on Nov. 14, 2004. Fravor's stunning retelling of his encounter off the California coast with what appeared to be a 40-foot-long wingless object that flew at incredible speeds in an erratic pattern comes as the Pentagon revealed the existence of a secret program to investigate sightings of UFOs.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Trump strategy document singles out Russia as bad actor globally
summary: By Steve Holland and James Oliphant WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump's administration said on Monday that Russia interferes in the domestic political affairs of countries globally, in a sober analysis of Moscow as a rival despite Trump's own bid for warmer ties with President Vladimir Putin. The criticism of Russia, laid out in a new national security strategy formed from Trump's "America First" foreign policy vision, reflects a view long held by U.S. diplomats that Russia actively undermines American interests at home and abroad. "Through modernized forms of subversive tactics, Russia interferes in the domestic political affairs of countries around the world," said the document.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: LeBron James' EQUALITY shoes were a repudiation of President Trump
summary: Cleveland Cavaliers forward LeBron James (23) wears Equality shoes against the Washington Wizards. As one of the NBA’s most expressive and politically active players, LeBron James’ shoes are a communication medium. For Sunday night’s away game against the Washington Wizards, James opted to wear a special pair of LeBron 15s, one white on his left foot and a black sneaker on his other foot.

author: DeltaBravo
title: 'Monster' California fire bears down on Santa Barbara
summary: The unforgiving Thomas Fire that has for 14 days ravaged Southern California north of Los Angeles this weekend began to bear down on affluent swaths of Santa Barbara and Montecito. According to the National Weather Service, a red flag warning remained in effect in both the mountains in Santa Barbara County and along the South Coast with humidity dropping to the teens and wind gusts topping 55 mph overnight.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: U.S. taxpayers rush to claim deductions under threat from tax bill
summary: Financial advisers and accountants are working overtime as many U.S. taxpayers scramble to pay the rest of their 2017 taxes before Jan. 1 when the proposed Republican tax overhaul would sharply cut the amount they can deduct on federal tax bills. The tax legislation, which top U.S. Republicans said on Sunday they expected Congress to pass this week, caps the amount of state, local and property taxes individuals can deduct from their federal tax bills at $10,000. The average American who itemized his or her tax bill in 2015 claimed more than $27,000 in deductions.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: The Bully from 'A Christmas Story' Still Makes Money off the Movie — and Gives It All to His Mom
summary: While the royalty checks are still coming, they’re not nearly as much as fans would expect.

author: captainunderoos
title: Davante Adams calls out Thomas Davis for 'head hunting' after brutal hit
summary: Davante Adams is tired of suffering concussions after illegal hits, and he vented about it on Twitter.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Stormy week ahead for holiday travel
summary: Two storm systems are expected to move through the country this week, just ahead of the Christmas holiday, bringing more than a foot of snow to some areas and heavy rain to others. On Thursday, the storm system will move out into the Plains, bringing heavy snow from Denver to the Twin Cities. By Saturday, the storm system will reach the East Coast, lashing the areas between New York City and Atlanta with heavy rain and a few thunderstorms.

author: captainunderoos
title: Colin Kaepernick and Stephen Curry want in on Diddy's bid for the Carolina Panthers
summary: Sean Combs wants to purchase the Carolina Panthers and he's already got two high-profile athletes ready to join him.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: The Trump tax cuts would save me $2,100
summary: Under the final tax bill President Trump is poised to sign within days, this reporter's annual tax payment would drop by about $2,100, compared with what he paid in 2016.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Remembering 'SNL' star Chris Farley on the anniversary of his death
summary: On the 20th anniversary of Chris Farley's death, we look back at five of his greatest 'Saturday Night Live' sketches.

author: nanook
title: ESPN president John Skipper resigns, citing substance addiction
summary: ESPN president John Skipper is stepping down from his post.

author: DeltaBravo
title: More controversial: Measuring a first down with an index card, or Steelers catch rule?
summary: There were some fun, great games on Sunday in the NFL. And in each of the two most visible games of the day, an officiating controversy ruled.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Tavis Smiley fires back at sexual misconduct allegations: 'PBS made a huge mistake'
summary: PBS suspended the distribution of his namesake talk show earlier this month after an investigation, citing "multiple, credible allegations," the network told ABC News in a statement. A PBS spokesperson said, "PBS engaged an outside law firm to conduct an investigation immediately after learning of troubling allegations regarding Mr. Smiley. This investigation included interviews with witnesses as well as with Mr. Smiley.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Trump allies say Mueller unlawfully obtained thousands of emails
summary: By Steve Holland WASHINGTON (Reuters) - An organization established for U.S. President Donald Trump's transition to the White House said on Saturday the special counsel investigating allegations of Russian meddling in the 2016 election had obtained tens of thousands of emails unlawfully. Kory Langhofer, counsel to the transition team known as Trump for America, Inc. (TFA), wrote a letter to congressional committees to say Special Counsel Robert Mueller's team had improperly received the emails from the General Services Administration (GSA), a government agency.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Republicans confident tax bill to become law this week
summary: By Amanda Becker and Lindsay Dunsmuir WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Top U.S. Republicans said on Sunday they expected Congress to pass a tax code overhaul this week, with a Senate vote as early as Tuesday and President Donald Trump aiming to sign the bill by week's end. John Cornyn, the No. 2 U.S. Senate Republican, said in an interview on ABC's "This Week" that he was "confident" the Senate would pass the legislation, "probably on Tuesday." Republican Representative Kevin Brady said he believed his party had the votes to pass the bill. "I think we are headed - the American people are headed - for a big win on Tuesday," Brady, the House of Representatives' top tax writer, said on Fox News' "Sunday Morning Futures with Maria Bartiromo." "We've worked hard to make sure that those strange Senate rules don't hang this up in any way," Brady added.

author: DeltaBravo
title: #MeToo movement highlights question for parents: How to raise good men
summary: The #MeToo movement that has encouraged women to speak out about their experiences of sexual harassment or assault, contributing to a recent wave of prominent American men facing accusations of sexual misconduct, has also sparked another conversation -- on parenting. “Good Morning America” is taking an in-depth look at that conversation by speaking with boys, parents and experts about raising good men.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Colorado State lineman walked 6 miles after being stranded at Atlanta airport
summary: A major power outage at the Atlanta airport caused hundreds of flight cancellations and left an estimated 30,000 people stranded.

author: third_watch
title: The 50 best movies of 2017
summary: It was a stellar year for movies, plain and simple.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Track Palin, son of politician Sarah Palin, arrested in Alaska
summary: The elder son of former Republican vice presidential nominee Sarah Palin was in jail on Sunday, facing assault and burglary charges in her home state of Alaska. Track Palin, 28, appeared in state court in Palmer, Alaska, earlier in the day, on a felony burglary charge and misdemeanor assault and criminal mischief charges, court records showed.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: How to take a cheap 'Star Wars' location vacation
summary: You don't need to travel to Tunisia to see Tatooine.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Jones: Trump shouldn't resign over misconduct allegations
summary: WASHINGTON (AP) — Democratic Sen.-elect Doug Jones says he doesn't think President Donald Trump should resign over allegations of sexual misconduct, echoing the White House's position that voters have already spoken on the issue.

author: Yahoo News
title: Puerto Rico gov orders review of all post-hurricane deaths
summary: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico (AP) — Puerto Rico's governor on Monday ordered authorities to review all deaths reported since Hurricane Maria hit nearly three months ago amid accusations that the U.S. territory has vastly undercounted storm-related deaths.

author: third_watch
title: Cowboys keep playoff hopes alive on dumbest rule, strangest measurement in football
summary: The Dallas Cowboys kept their playoff hopes alive thanks to a dumb rule and a strange measurement.

author: DeltaBravo
title: 'Seinfeld' writers talk 'The Strike' (aka the Festivus show) on its 20th anniversary
summary: The classic 'Seinfeld' episode 'The Strike' is remembered most for introducing the world to Festivus, but the half-hour also features many non-Festivus classic moments.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Someone has attacked this Iraq War veteran and stolen her service dog
summary: Let's see if the internet can help Ashley reunite with Jax.
